title.rendered: Requirements for Nanny Visa in Canada from India

content.rendered:
[vc_row type=”full_width_content” full_screen_row_position=”middle” column_margin=”default” column_direction=”default” column_direction_tablet=”default” column_direction_phone=”default” scene_position=”center” top_padding_phone=”15%” bottom_padding_phone=”15%” left_padding_phone=”7%” right_padding_phone=”7%” text_color=”dark” text_align=”left” row_border_radius=”none” row_border_radius_applies=”bg” overlay_strength=”0.3″ gradient_direction=”left_to_right” shape_divider_position=”bottom” bg_image_animation=”none” shape_type=””][vc_column column_padding=”no-extra-padding” column_padding_tablet=”no-extra-padding” column_padding_phone=”no-extra-padding” column_padding_position=”left-right” column_element_spacing=”30px” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”1/12″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” tablet_text_alignment=”default” phone_text_alignment=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][/vc_column][vc_column column_padding=”padding-5-percent” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”no-extra-padding” column_padding_position=”left-right” top_margin=”5%” column_element_spacing=”30px” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”7/12″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” tablet_text_alignment=”default” phone_text_alignment=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”]
Share Tweet Share Pin
[vc_column_text]“What requirements do I need to meet to apply for Canada Nanny Visa from India?”

While there is no dedicated nanny visa in Canada, the Canadian Government has introduced two programs designed to help nannies and caregivers from countries such as India come to Canada and work in these professions. These are the Home Support Worker Program and Home Child Care Provider Program. Both these programs were introduced in 2019 and fall under the Caregiver Visa Canada. Let’s first understand the basic eligibility requirements for Nanny Visa Canada from India in detail.[/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”middle” column_margin=”default” column_direction=”default” column_direction_tablet=”default” column_direction_phone=”default” text_align=”left”][vc_column_inner column_padding=”padding-6-percent” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”all” column_element_spacing=”default” centered_text=”true” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”1/1″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][nectar_btn size=”large” button_style=”regular” button_color_2=”Accent-Color” icon_family=”default_arrow” text=”Check You Eligibility Now” url=”https://bit.ly/start-free-assessment”][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_custom_heading text=”4 Basic Requirements for Nanny Visa in Canada from India” use_theme_fonts=”yes” el_id=”apply-for-visitor-visa”][vc_column_text]You will need to meet requirements related to education, language proficiency, work experience, and a job offer before applying for either the Home Support Worker and Child Care Provider programs. These nanny program requirements are explained in greater detail below.[/vc_column_text][vc_custom_heading text=”1. Education Requirements” font_container=”tag:h3|text_align:left” use_theme_fonts=”yes”][vc_column_text]The Home Support Worker and Child Care Provider programs accept candidates from different educational backgrounds. However, these program gives preferences to people with:

  • General Nursing and Midwifery (GNM) Diploma
  • A Bachelor’s degree in Nursing

Suppose you don’t have either of the above education credentials. In that case, you can still apply to the Home Support Worker and Child Care Provider programs as long as you have completed one year of post-secondary education after the 12th standard.

However, you must ensure this post-secondary education meets Canadian education standards by getting your credential evaluated by World Education Services (WES).[/vc_column_text][vc_custom_heading text=”2. Language Requirements” font_container=”tag:h3|text_align:left” use_theme_fonts=”yes”][vc_column_text]You must score a CLB 5 or higher (recommended for a strong case) on an English language proficiency exam such as IELTS to apply to either the Home Support Worker or Child Care Provider program.[/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”middle” column_margin=”default” column_direction=”default” column_direction_tablet=”default” column_direction_phone=”default” top_padding=”5%” bottom_padding=”5%” text_align=”left”][vc_column_inner column_padding=”no-extra-padding” hover_animation=”none” alignment=”” border_radius=”none” box_shadow=”none” image_loading=”default” max_width=”100%” max_width_mobile=”default”][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner column_padding=”padding-6-percent” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”all” column_element_spacing=”default” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”1/2″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”1px” column_border_color=”#707070″ column_border_style=”solid”][vc_custom_heading text=”Apply for Nanny Work Visa from India” font_container=”tag:h3|text_align:left” use_theme_fonts=”yes”][nectar_btn size=”large” button_style=”regular” button_color_2=”Accent-Color” icon_family=”none” text=”Speak with an expert” url=”https://www.elaarimmigration.ca/contact-us/” margin_top=”20px”][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_custom_heading text=”3. Work Experience Requirements” font_container=”tag:h3|text_align:left” use_theme_fonts=”yes” css=”.vc_custom_1665764568459{margin-top: 20px !important;}”][vc_column_text]You must possess a minimum of 2 years of work experience relevant to the program you intend to apply to.

If you plan to apply to the Home Support Worker Program Canada, your work experience must be in an occupation that falls under the TEER 44101 job code. This includes roles such as:

  • Family caregivers
  • Live-in caregivers
  • Attendants for people with disabilities
  • Personal care attendants
  • Respite workers

The job duties under TEER 44101 include:

  • Providing care and companionship to families or individuals who are incapacitated, are recovering from illness, or have experienced family disruption.
  • Providing personal care and bedside assistance such as aid, personal hygiene, bathing, and dressing.
  • Preparing meals in line with special diets and feeding clients.
  • Performing health-related duties, including administering medications, changing dressings, and collecting specimens under the supervision of a nurse or home care agency
  • Performing housekeeping duties such as making beds, washing dishes, and doing laundry

If you plan to apply to the Home Child Care Provider Program Canada, your work experience must be in an occupation that falls under the TEER 44100 job code. This includes roles such as:

  • Nannies
  • Babysitters
  • Childcare live-in caregivers
  • Parent’s helpers

The job duties under TEER 44100 include:

  • Supervising and looking after children in the employer’s residence or your own residence
  • Bathing, dressing, and feeding infants and children
  • Preparing formulas and changing diapers for infants
  • Planning, preparing and serving meals to children
  • Overseeing children’s activities, including rest periods and meals under the employer’s instructions
  • Maintaining a healthy and safe environment in the employer’s home
  • Instructing children on matters related to personal hygiene
  • Tending to the social development and emotional well-being of children
  • Disciplining children by following the methods chosen by the parents
  • Providing age-appropriate educational training via organized activities. This includes games, outings, crafts, and readings.
  • Taking children to and from school and helping them reach appointments
  • Keeping records of child activities and health information daily

Here is a useful resource to understand support received by caregivers in Canada[/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”middle” column_margin=”default” column_direction=”default” column_direction_tablet=”default” column_direction_phone=”default” top_padding=”5%” bottom_padding=”5%” text_align=”left”][vc_column_inner column_padding=”no-extra-padding” column_padding=”padding-6-percent” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”all” column_element_spacing=”default” background_color_opacity=”1″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”1px” column_border_color=”#707070″ column_border_style=”solid”][vc_custom_heading text=”Are you eligible for Nanny Visa Canada?” font_container=”tag:h3|text_align:left” use_theme_fonts=”yes”][nectar_btn size=”large” open_new_tab=”true” button_style=”regular” button_color_2=”Accent-Color” icon_family=”none” text=”Check Eligibility” url=”https://www.immefile.ca/public/assessment/elaarimmigration” margin_top=”20px”][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_custom_heading text=”4. Job Requirements” font_container=”tag:h3|text_align:left” use_theme_fonts=”yes” css=”.vc_custom_1665765864590{margin-top: 20px !important;}”][vc_column_text]You will also need a valid job offer from a Canadian employer. This job will need to fall under the TEER 44101 job code if you are applying for the Home Support Worker program and TEER 44100 if you are applying for the Child Care Provider program.

This job offer must also be:

  • Full-time, which amounts to 30 hours or more per week
  • Located outside Quebec
  • Non-seasonal
[/vc_column_text][vc_custom_heading text=”How to Apply for the Nanny Visa Programs” use_theme_fonts=”yes”][vc_column_text]The application process for both the Home Support Worker Pilot and the Home Child Care Provider Pilots is identical. The steps are summarized below:

  1. Obtain a valid Offer of Employment from a Canadian employer
  2. Submit a completed work permit application under the Home Support Worker Pilot Program or Home Child Care Provider Program
  3. Come to Canada with your work permit and work for your Canadian employer.
  4. Once you have one year of work experience (as of April 30, 2023) in a nanny or caregiver role, you can apply for permanent residence.
[/vc_column_text][vc_custom_heading text=”Why You Should Apply for the Nanny Visa Programs from India Now?” use_theme_fonts=”yes”][vc_column_text]The Home Support Worker pilot and Home Child Care Provider programs are incredibly popular with Indians who wish to work as nannies in Canada. They can also use the work experience they gain in the country to apply for permanent residence.

Canada currently processes only 2,750 Home Support Worker Pilot and 2,750 Home Child Care Provider Pilot applications each year. If you intend to apply to either of these programs in 2022, you must start the application process as quickly as possible.[/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”middle” column_margin=”default” column_direction=”default” column_direction_tablet=”default” column_direction_phone=”default” top_padding=”5%” bottom_padding=”5%” text_align=”left”][vc_column_inner Nanny Visa Jan 2023 Intake Now” font_container=”tag:h3|text_align:left” use_theme_fonts=”yes”][nectar_btn size=”large” button_style=”regular” button_color_2=”Accent-Color” icon_family=”none” text=”Book a Consultation” url=”http://elaarimmigration.ca/book-consultation/” margin_top=”20px”][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_custom_heading text=”Need help?” use_theme_fonts=”yes”][vc_column_text]The programs mentioned above offer an excellent pathway for Indians with child care and caregiving work experience to come to Canada and work. Many Indian nannies use these pathways to eventually get permanent residence and settle in Canada.

If you’re interested in applying for the Nanny Visa Canada from India, contact our experts here. Our skilled team of Regulated Canadian Immigration Consultants is familiar with the Home Support Worker Pilot and Home Child Care Provider Programs and can assist you with your application.

Also Read:

  • How Does Canadian Nanny Sponsorship Work for Caregivers?
  • 5 Ways to Immigrate to Canada as a Nurse

excerpt.rendered: In order to obtain a Nanny Visa Canada from India, Indian nannies or childcare providers must meet the following requirements.
